title: PHPfilemtime()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPfilemtime()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content: Example Get the last time the file content was modified: "; echo "Content last changed: ".date("F d Y H:i:s.", filemtime("webdictionary.txt")); ?> Run Example » Definition and Usage The filemtime() function returns the last time the file content was modified. Note: The result of this function is cached. Use clearstatcache() to clear the cache. Syntax filemtime( filename ) Parameter Values Parameter Description filename Required. Specifies the path to the file to check Technical Details Return Value: The last time the file content was modified as a Unix timestamp, FALSE on failure PHP Version: 4.0+ ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code: "; echo "Content last changed: ".date("F d Y H:i:s.", filemtime("webdictionary.txt")); ?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPfilemtime()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPfilemtime()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPfilemtime()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
